overview.trophyNone: Clear all Rounds once to get a Trophy!

description.giveUp: Give up and return to the lobby.
description.rush: Continue to the next round. Only 50% of your health is restored.
description.nextRound: Take on the next round in the cup.
description.summary: Take a look at your trophy and your progress with all rounds in the cup.

descriptions.WEAPON_ADJUST: Ascended Gear Level will be adjusted to round level.
descriptions.NO_MELEE: Close Combat and Melee Arts are disabled.
descriptions.NO_RANGED: Throwing and Throw Arts are disabled.
descriptions.NO_DASH: Dashing and Dash Arts are disabled.
descriptions.NO_GUARD: Guarding and Guard Arts are disabled.
descriptions.PVP_BATTLE: PVP Combat - Penalty for taken damage is reduced.

menu.creator: Creator
menu.objectiveRushMode: Clear every round \c[3]without stopping\c[0] and only \c[3]regenerate 50% of your health between rounds.\c[0]
menu.bonusNone: Select a round to see which bonus objectives are available.
menu.roundUnlockCond: Clear the previous round to unlock this round.

trade.toggleDes: Toggle to display the difference to the current equip or see the raw stats.
trade.equipInfo: One or more items you need are currently equipped! Unequip and proceed with the trade?

dialogs.slotsOverflow: Reached maximum number of slots! Delete some to create new save files.
dialogs.loadNewGameConfirm: Use this save to carry over data and start a new game with the selected options?
dialogs.deleteConfirm: Do you really want to delete this save file?
dialogs.cancelConfirm: Do you really want to cancel?
dialogs.skipConfirm: Do you want to skip this scene?
dialogs.sellRare: One or more items you are trying to sell are of legendary rarity or higher. Still sale?

title-screen.select: Select a demo mode to try out!

perform-warn-text.old-nwjs:
\c[3]Performance Warning!\c[0]
You're playing CrossCode with an \c[3]old version\c[0] of NW.js.
For many players, this version has shown to perform poorly, especially with modern graphics cards.
If the game runs slow for you, consider disabling the use of the 'nwjs_old' BETA branch.
perform-warn-text.sample-rate:
\c[3]Performance Warning!\c[0]
You're playing CrossCode with a \c[3]high sampleRate\c[0] setting for your Audio Output Device of \c[3][X]\c[0].
This has shown to increase memory consumption and makes the game more likely to \c[3]crash\c[0].
We recommend to play the game with a lower sampleRate setting of \c[3]96000 Hz or lower\c[0].
On windows, you can change the sample rate through the \c[3]Sound Control Panel\c[0], in the \c[3]Properties\c[0] of your active \c[3]Playback Device\c[0] by changing the \c[3]Default Format\c[0] in the \c[3]Advanced\c[0] tab.

pause-screen.info: Press ESC or P to return to the Game
pause-screen.lang-fix: Found a typo? Press \c[3]F7 to open the Lang Editor\c[0] and send us the fix!

lang-edit.title: Language Edit
lang-edit.comment: Additional Comments here, edit text in field above

gamepad-box.info-text:
You can play CrossCode with any X-Input compatible gamepad.
What to do:
1. Connect your gamepad
2. Press any button (not the analogue sticks)
If you read 'connected' next to the gamepad symbol, your gamepad should work!

description.analyze: Analyze the the enemies on the field.

TARGET: Party members will focus enemies as they please.
Party members will focus the same enemy as you.
Party members will focus enemies you are not attacking.
BEHAVIOUR: Party members will use an aggressive playstyle.
Party members will stay back and focus defensive maneuvers.
Party members will stay far away and do nothing.
ARTS: Party members will use combat arts at a normal interval.
Party members will use combat arts as much as possible.
Party members will never use any combat arts.

descriptions.FREE: Your party members will take action as they see fit.
descriptions.FOCUS_ENEMY: Your party members will focus the same enemy as you.
descriptions.FOCUS_DEFENSE: Your party members will stay back and focus on defending/evading attacks.
descriptions.NOTHING: Your Party members will do absolutely nothing and stay back.

quick-menu.noData: Insufficient Data! Fight against this enemy to reveal more information.

shop.leaveWithCartItems: Items are in your cart. Still return?

new-game.saveFileInfo: Please select a \i[save-star] save file from which to carry over the selected options.
new-game.confirmOptions: Start a new game with the selected options?

sets.carry-over: Carry Over from a save file

dialogs.normalDescription: Experience the story of CrossCode just like before!
dialogs.plusDescription: Use your accumulated \c[3]Trophy Points\c[0] to customize your game!

descriptions.double-buff-time: Doubles the length of all consumables items.
descriptions.drop-rate-2: Increases drop rate for items from plants and enemies by 100%.
descriptions.drop-rate-4: Increases drop rate for items from plants and enemies by 300%.
descriptions.keep-consumables: Keep all your consumables. (Favorites are reset)
descriptions.keep-equipment: Keep all your equipment. (Equipped items are moved to your inventory)
descriptions.keep-addons: Keep all Add-Ons. (Add-Ons are switched off)
descriptions.keep-elements: Keep all elements. (Elements will be activated once obtaining the neutral mode)
descriptions.money-plus-2: Gain 100% more credits from all sources.
descriptions.money-plus-4: Gain 300% more credits from all sources.
descriptions.exp-plus-2: Gain 100% more experience from all sources.
descriptions.exp-plus-4: Gain 300% more experience from all sources.
descriptions.disable-money: Disable gaining money. This includes selling items in shops!
descriptions.dash-1: Start with only one dash that has 3 times the invincibility and less ending lag.
descriptions.witch-time: Every time you do a perfect dash, time slows down for a few seconds.
descriptions.waypoints-heals: Healing out of combat only possible at Landmarks.
descriptions.waypoints-teleport: Using the map menu to teleport is only possible at Landmarks.
descriptions.scale-enemies: Regular enemy & boss levels will be matched to your stat average.
descriptions.harder-enemies: Normal enemies & Bosses will be more aggressive.
descriptions.sergey-hax: Enable Sergey's hacks and do insane damage all the time.
descriptions.rhombus-start: Start directly at the Newcomer's Bridge in Rhombus Square.
descriptions.combat-arts-level-1: You can only do level 1 Combat Arts, no matter what else you have unlocked.
descriptions.combat-arts-level-2: You can only do up to level 2 Combat Arts, no matter what else you have unlocked.
descriptions.overload-disable: Overload is disabled, meaning you can stay in element mode as long as you wish.
descriptions.infinite-sp: You are always at max SP and using Combat Arts do not consume any SP.
descriptions.enemy-aggro: Regular enemies in the field will always attack on sight.
descriptions.item-cd-double: The cooldown for consumables is twice as long in combat.
descriptions.item-cd-half: The cooldown for consumables is half as long in combat.
descriptions.item-cd-zero: There is no cooldown when using consumables in combat.
descriptions.remove-skill-blocks: Remove all shade blockades in the Circuit-Tree.
descriptions.combat-regen-half: HP Regeneration in combat is cut in half.
descriptions.combat-regen-zero: HP Regeneration is disabled in combat.
descriptions.no-trophies: Disables being able to unlock any Trophies.
descriptions.ice-physics: Ice Physics are toggled on at all times.

rhombus.help: \i[help-icon]Select a location on the map you would like to travel to!

description.points: Shows your accumulated arena coins. Win Cups to gain more coins. The higher your score, the higher your reward!
description.highscore: Shows the combined score of all rounds including the Rush Mode score.
description.highscoreRound: Shows the highest score you have achieved. Below you can see how much points you need for the silver and gold medal.
description.time: Shows the combined time of all rounds. Below is the best time achieved in Rush Mode.
description.difficulty: Indicates the difficulty of a cup. Ranging from 1 to 5 swords. 5 being the most difficult.
description.coins: Shows the obtained Arena Coins and the maximum coins available in a cup.
description.coinsRound: Shows the obtained and maximum Arena coins in a round or Rush Mode.
description.rounds: Shows the number of rounds cleared and the total rounds in a cup. Below you can see what Rush Mode medal was achieved in a cup.
description.timeRound: Shows the best time achieved in a round or Rush Mode.
description.avgLevel: Shows the average enemy level present in a cup.
description.clears: Shows the number of times a round or Rush Mode was completed.
description.objective: Shows what you need to do in order to successfully clear a round or Ruse Mode.
description.bonus: Shows optional bonus challenges that reward you with extra points, crucial to reach the highest score.
description.challenges: Shows additional conditions that may apply to this round. Conditions with yellow outlines are active for the entire cup.
description.creator: Shows who created the selected cup.

description.rate: Shows how much of the quests available at this Bulletin Board have been finished. This does not count hidden quests.
description.available: Shows the number of quests currently available in the surrounding areas. Come back from time to time to find new quests.

description.rate: Shows how much trophies are unlocked as a percentage.
description.points: Shows the total number of trophy points acquired.

colorDesc.green: Indicates that the levels are well aligned.
colorDesc.white: Indicates that the levels are aligned good enough.
colorDesc.orange: Indicates that the levels are not well aligned.
colorDesc.red: Indicates that the levels are badly aligned, which could lead to problems when fighting enemies of a similiar level.

description.hp: Shows you your current and Max HP.
description.sp: Shows you your current and Max SP.
description.exp: Shows how much more experience you need for a level up.
description.buffs: A list of all your active buffs.
description.favs: You favorite consumables. Add one to see its name and description here.
description.avail: Shows where your commonly find a trade item.

description.element: Values below are displayed for the element shown here. See the manual to see how to switch between elements.
description.page: Name of the current Page. See the manual to see how to switch between pages.

description.level: Shows the suggested level for you to be to do this quest.
description.type: Quests with a red exclamation mark are much more difficult but reap better rewards and challenges.
description.content: Display the tasks you have already finished and the one you currently have to completed. The 3 dots show that more tasks have been finished and can be checked int the detailed view.
description.content2: Displays all tasks for the quest in a scrollable view.
description.location: This shows where you started the quest.
description.owner: Shows you the name and image of the quest giver.
description.rewards: A list of rewards you can obtain for finishing the quest. Entries with a question mark are revealed once the the quest is completed too.

description.points: An overview over the points you have available for each element tree.
description.branch: Shows the skills on one side of a skill branch. The arrows shows which skills are swapped.

description.equip: The equipment of the selected friend. They will automatically upgrade when visiting shops.

description.objective: Your current objective. This is tied to your story progress. Check back if you ever get lost.
description.quest: Shows the current marked quest and the current task for the quest.
description.activity: Displays your latest activities, such as quest tasks, new encyclopedia entries and more.

description.chest: Shows you the amount of chests left to find in this area.
description.stamps: Shows you the amount of stamps set by yourself as well the maximum per area.

description.type: This displays the type of the lore entry. Note that some entries can still be uncompleted as indicated by the percentage.
description.content: The content of the entry. Unlocked more pages for an entry by exploring the world!

description.info: Displays the trader and the location to find him.
description.content: Shows what items are needed to acquire this item. Current owned items are shown in brackets.
description.money: Find the fee you need to pay for the trade here.

description.type: The type of the enemy as indicated by the tab. Golden ones are bosses and have a special tab.
description.res: Shows the elemental resistance of the selected enemy. The lower the value the more damage you do with the shown element.
description.view: Displays the enemy. Maybe if you wait, you can see them do something special? Below the display you can find the EXP and Credit gained by defeating an enemy.
description.rewards: Shows you the items you can get by defeating this enemy, including the rank needed. To unveil the name of the item you only need to have at least found one of it.
description.maxhp: Maximum amount of Health Points for the selected enemy.
description.atk: Attack power of the selected enemy.
description.def: Defensive power of the selected enemy.
description.foc: Focus of the selected enemy. Determines how often it deals critical hits.

description.info: After analyzing an object long enough by collecting its drop you find the location and drop chances for them here.

des.level: Sorty the list by item level. Highest first.
des.auto: Sorts the list by a natural order.
des.area: Sorts the list by the area the enemy is found in.
des.enemyLevel: Sorts the list based on the level of the enemies.
des.unlocked: Sorts the list by unlocked entries. Unlocked Entries are sorted by \c[3]Auto\c[0].
des.name: Sorts the list by the item's names.
des.amount: Sorts the list based on the amount of each item.
des.rarity: Sorts the list based on the rarity of each item.
des.questLevel: Sorts the list based on the level of the quest.
des.questAccepted: Sorts the list based on the time or date you accepted the quest.
des.hp: Sorts the list by the hp stat of the equipment.
des.attack: Sorts the list by the attack stat of the equipment.
des.defense: Sorts the list by the defense stat of the equipment.
des.focus: Sorts the list by the focus stat of the equipment.
des.status: Sorts the list by the online status and if the player is in your party.
des.socialLevel: Sorts the list by the level of the contacts.
des.invite: Invite the player to join your party.
des.inviteFull: Can't invite because party is full.
des.locked: Cannot be added or removed right now.
des.remove: Remove the player from your current party.
des.contact: Contact or leave a voice message for the player via Direct Link.
des.trader: Sorts the traders by the order you found them. Newest first.
des.botanics: Sorts the plants by the order you found them. Newest first.
des.botanicsName: Sorts the list by the plant's names.
des.featLock: Sorts the list by unlocked trophies first.
des.featName: Sorts the list by the name of the Trophies.
des.featPoints: Sorts the list by the amount of points you can get, highest first.

description.items: Browse through your items and select favorite consumables.
description.skills: Upgrade your abilities by activating nodes on the circuit boards.
description.equipment: Equip items to enhance your battle stats.
description.status: Check your Status, including all Skills, Modifiers and Equipment.
description.synopsis: See all the things you found and experienced in CrossWorlds.
description.map: Take a look at your current location and use the Teleport-System.
description.quests: Take a look at all active and completed quests.
description.options: Change the options to fit your play style.
description.social: Add, remove or just interact with your friends and contacts.

descriptions.levels:
Displays the current player- and average equipment level.
 - Green: Levels are aligned.
 -White: Levels are okay
descriptions.maxhp: Maximum amount of Health Points. Determines the damage you can survive and the efficiency of regeneration.
descriptions.atk: Increases the damage of your attacks. The higher the number, the more damage can be inflicted.
descriptions.def: Reduces the damage you take from hostile attacks and increases the power of your shield.
descriptions.foc: Determines the probability of critical hits, your SP gain, status conditions rate and invincibility while dashing.
descriptions.heat: Resistance against the heat element. The higher the number the less damage you take from heat attacks.
descriptions.cold: Resistance against the cold element. The higher the number the less damage you take from cold attacks.
descriptions.shock: Resistance against the shock element. The higher the number the less damage you take from shock attacks.
descriptions.wave: Resistance against the wave element. The higher the number the less damage you take from wave attacks.
descriptions.ITEM_GUARD: Using Items cannot be stopped by any attacks. However you can still suffer damage.
descriptions.SP_REGEN: Increases SP regeneration of any form.
descriptions.MELEE_DMG: Increases damage done by close combat attacks, including Melee Combat Arts.
descriptions.AIM_SPEED: Increases the speed of getting precise aiming.
descriptions.XP_ZERO: Disables exp gain from defeating enemies.
descriptions.XP_PLUS: Increases amount of experience gained from defeating enemies
descriptions.RANGED_DMG: Increases damage done by ranged attacks, including Throw Combat Arts.
descriptions.KNOCKBACK: Increases knockback from charged shots on enemies.
descriptions.ASSAULT: Fires additional projectiles when using melee attacks with a fraction of the attacks strength.
descriptions.DASH_INVINC: Increases the duration of invincibility when dashing.
descriptions.STUN_THRESHOLD: Increases knockback resistance to weak attacks, depending on your MaxHP.
descriptions.HP_REGEN: Regenerates given percentage of HP over 60 seconds of combat. Healing frequency increases with higher percentage.
descriptions.DROP_CHANCE: Increases drop rate for items from enemies and environmental objects.
descriptions.GUARD_STRENGTH: Strengthens your shield and decreases the damage taken while guarding.
descriptions.ITEM_BOOST: Increases the effect of healing items and duration of buff items.
descriptions.OVERHEAT_REDUCTION: Slows down Overload while using an element.
descriptions.AIM_STABILITY: Decreases the loss of aim from quick aim movement and dashes.
descriptions.SPIKE_DMG: Damages enemies that hit your shield, based on the absorbed damage and defense.
descriptions.AIMING_MOVEMENT: Increases your movement speed while aiming.
descriptions.MONEY_PLUS: Increases the amount of credits you get from defeating enemies.
descriptions.CROSS_COUNTER: Increases damage on attacking or charging enemies.
descriptions.ONCE_MORE: Survive exactly one attack that would normally kill you.
descriptions.PERFECT_GUARD_RESET: Resets your perfect guard when landing a successful perfect guard.
descriptions.PERFECT_GUARD_WINDOW: Increases the time window for a perfect guard.
descriptions.GUARD_SP: Restores SP on guard based on the power of the attack. Double that for a perfect guard.
descriptions.RANK_PLANTS: Combat Rank also increases the drop rate of items from environment objects.
descriptions.BREAK_DMG: Increase damage on enemies that are in stunned, weak or in break state.
descriptions.BERSERK: Increases damage dealt when at critical HP. (Below 33% of Max HP)
descriptions.MOMENTUM: Increases damage dealt immediately after dashes. Repeated dashes further increase the damage.
descriptions.GUARD_AREA: Allows to guard against attacks from the side. Activate twice to shield attacks from above too.
descriptions.APPETITE: Increases numbers of available buff slots. Every step of 100 unlocks another one.
descriptions.COND_EFFECT_HEAT: Increases the speed of inflicting the \c[3]Burn\c[0] Condition and its effect. \c[3]Burn\c[0] causes damage over time, depending on the MaxHP of the victim.
descriptions.COND_EFFECT_COLD: Increases the speed of inflicting the \c[3]Chill\c[0] Condition and its effect. \c[3]Chill\c[0] decreases the overall speed of the victim.
descriptions.COND_EFFECT_SHOCK: Increases the speed of inflicting the \c[3]Jolt\c[0] Condition and its effect. \c[3]Jolt\c[0] causes damage and stuns in short intervals.
descriptions.COND_EFFECT_WAVE: Increases the speed of inflicting the \c[3]Mark\c[0] Condition and its effect. \c[3]Mark\c[0] increases the received ranged damage by 50%.
descriptions.COND_EFFECT_ALL: Increases the speed of inflicting a \c[3]Status Condition\c[0] and its effect.
descriptions.COND_GUARD_HEAT: Increases the resistance against the \c[3]Burn\c[0] Condition and reduces its effect. \c[3]Burn\c[0] causes damage over time, depending on the MaxHP of the victim.
descriptions.COND_GUARD_COLD: Increases the resistance against the \c[3]Chill\c[0] Condition and reduces its effect. \c[3]Chill\c[0] decreases the overall speed of the victim.
descriptions.COND_GUARD_SHOCK: Increases the resistance against the \c[3]Jolt\c[0] Condition and reduces its effect. \c[3]Jolt\c[0] causes damage and stuns in short intervals.
descriptions.COND_GUARD_WAVE: Increases the resistance against the \c[3]Mark\c[0] Condition and reduces its effect. \c[3]Mark\c[0] increases the received ranged damage by 50%.
descriptions.COND_HEALING: Increases the recovery speed from negative status conditions.
descriptions.SPIDER_SLOW_DOWN_GUARD: Makes it possible to freely walk on the sticky webs created by the \v[combat.name.forest/spider] and sub-species.
descriptions.BEGONE_ICE: Makes it possible to normally run and perform actions on ice without slipping.
descriptions.EQUIP_SCALE: Base Parameters of this equipment automatically scale with your current level.

skill.shade: Find the [xyz] to break the chains and unlock more skills.
skill.chain-des: Use \c[3]Activate All\c[0] to activate all previous skills and this one with sufficient CP.
skill.learn-prev: Activate previous nodes to see this one!

save-menu.delete-info-content: Hover over a slot (except the auto save slot and the new save file slot) and press \i[help2] to delete the slot.
save-menu.description-save: Select a slot to save to.
save-menu.description-load: Select a slot to load from.
save-menu.description-newgame: Select a slot from which to carry over data.

descriptions.map: Take a look at your current location and use the Teleport-System.
descriptions.quests: Take a look at all active and completed quests.
descriptions.lore: View a synopsis of the story so far or read about the lore of the game.
descriptions.trophies: Bask in the glory of your trophies and find new ones to accomplish.
descriptions.records: Admire a detailed record of your various stats and activities.
descriptions.items: Here you can find a detailed list of all items and where to find them.
descriptions.trade: Look up the locations and offers of every trader you found so far.
descriptions.enemies: Find detailed information about all the enemies you have come across on your journey.
descriptions.museum: Enjoy the things you have unlocked.
descriptions.help: Missed a description or a helpful hint? Find it in this section.
descriptions.botanics: Look up all environment objects of CrossWorlds and what kind of items they can drop.
descriptions.newgame: Take a look at the \c[3]New Game Plus\c[0] options you have selected.

enemy.killMore: Defeat \c[3][x]\c[0] more [y] to unlock this page!

keys.streakKilled: Most Enemies Defeated in one Streak
keys.finalStat: Total Number of Stats in this Menu
keys.hiCount: Total Number of Times Lea said "Hi"
keys.yawns: Total Number of Times Lea was bored
keys.questActive: Max Number of Simultaneous Active Quests
keys.rewardCp: Total Circuit Points gained through Quests
keys.skillPoints: Total Number of Skill Points Used
keys.randomNumber: Here is a Random Number for you

map-menu.popupDesc: Hover over any place you like to set a Stamp and press \i[help3] to set it. Stamps cannot be set close to other Stamps or Landmarks.

content: Welcome to the Inventory!
This is where you can take a look at all your collected items or set certain consumables as your favorites.
Use \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right] to cycle through the categories or press on the tabs if you use the mouse.
The first tab shows the last items you have collected to keep an eye on all your loot!

pages.title: \c[3]Inventory Menu\c[0] - Consumables
content: Most consumables are \c[3]buffs used to aid you in battle\c[0]. Hovering over a consumable that is also a buff shows a little interface telling you what the item does in the \c[3]bottom left corner\c[0].

The symbols you see tell you what stat or modifier changes and how strong the stat is increased. While in the Help Screen, select the \c[3]UI in the bottom-left\c[0] to see what each of the symbols mean.

pages.title: \c[3]Inventory Menu\c[0] - Add-Ons
content: Add-Ons are helpful items or visual effects you can toggle on and off as your please!

Items in this category are grouped in \c[3]Sets\c[0]. In Sets with \c[3]round checkboxes, only one\c[0] of the items in the set can be active at the same time. \c[3]Square-shaped checkboxes\c[0] indicated a set where you can \c[3]toggle any item\c[0].

inventory.title: \c[3]Inventory Menu\c[0]
inventory.text-2: Hover over an item in the Consumables Section and press \i[help2] to add it as a favorite

content: Welcome to the Equipment Menu!
In this menu you can equip your collected gear into 5 different slots.
These are \c[3]Head\c[0], \c[3]Right Arm\c[0], \c[3]Left Arm\c[0], \c[3]Torso\c[0] and \c[3]Legs\c[0].
Select a body part by clicking on one of the buttons. You can also use the mouse to click on the buttons in the center.
Additionally you can cycle through the body parts using \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] or \i[left] and \i[right].
Press \i[help2] to go directly to the status menu.

pages.title: \c[3]Equipment Menu\c[0] - Stats & Modifiers
content: Hovering over a piece of equipment shows the changes to your \c[3]status\c[0] on the left. Having already equipped an item will show how your parameters change when switching to another piece of gear.
\c[3]Modifiers\c[0] are shown below the status parameters. Press \i[skip-cutscene] to expand the list if more modifiers are equipped or shown then fit into the list.
Use the \c[3]Status Menu's "Modifier"-List\c[0] to get a detailed description for each equipped modifier.
Welcome to the Circuit Menu!
In this menu you can spend your collected \c[3]Cross Points (CP)\c[0] to unlock skills on the skill trees.
select one of the unlocked trees and press on it to enter the detailed view of the associated tree.
Scroll right to get more info on the detailed view that appears once you press on one of the trees.

pages.title: \c[3]Circuit Menu\c[0] - Detail View
content: Use \i[key-up]\i[key-left]\i[key-down]\i[key-right] or drag the mouse to move around the skill tree.
With the gamepad you can use \i[left-stick] to move the cursor around and \i[right-stick] to just move the camera.
Hover over a skill to see what it does and how many CP you need to activate it.

Note that in order to activate a skill you must first unlock its parent. Alternatively you can activate all parent skills provided you have enough CP. In that case the button will display the text \c[3]Activate All\c[0].

pages.title: \c[3]Circuit Menu\c[0] - Branches
content: Notice the branches on some paths along the skill tree? Those always offer 2 ways and you can only walk on one of them.
However you can \c[3]switch between both paths at any time without spending any additional points\c[0] as long as you have a skill activated on one of the branch paths.
By pressing \i[help2] you can enter a special swap mode in the overview where you can quickly swap branches. Just select a panel and press it to swap the skills!

pages.title: \c[3]Circuit Menu\c[0] - Combat Arts
content: The aforementioned branches always contain at least one \c[3]Combat Art\c[0] on each way, which you can recognize by their \c[3]light-grey background\c[0].
Those Combat Arts are skills that don't increase your parameters but instead allow you to perform special abilities during combat, in exchange for \c[3]Special Points (SP)\c[0].
Combat Arts can greatly increase your chances in battle, so it is advised that you learn at least one of them as quickly as possible!
Welcome to the Map Menu!
Here you can check out your current location displayed as a \c[3]red box and white dotted lines\c[0], see how many treasures you have found and use the teleport system.
Use \i[key-up]\i[key-left]\i[key-down]\i[key-right] to move the camera or drag with the mouse. You can also use \i[left-stick] to move or \i[right-stick] to pan the camera with the gamepad.
Pressing \i[help3] places a custom \c[3]Stamp\c[0]. You can update the stamp by clicking on it or creating one.

pages.title: \c[3]Map Menu\c[0] - Teleport System
content: Once a \c[3]Landmark\c[0] is activated it can be selected by hovering over the symbol \i[landmark] with the mouse or the gamepad cursor.
Clicking or pressing \i[gamepad-a] on the gamepad opens a confirmation dialog.
Selecting yes closes the menu and teleports Lea to the location of the landmark
If a landmark is greyed out it means it was blocked. (eg. because of Story progression) To access them, simply find them gain.

pages.title: \c[3]Map Menu\c[0] - Worldmap
content: Pressing \i[help2] opens or closes the worldmap of CrossWorlds. In this menu you can select an area you have already visited.
Hovering over an area reveals the name, a short description and the chests found in the area.
Clicking or pressing \i[gamepad-a] on the gamepad displays the maps of the area. Here you can use the teleport system to warp you to landmarks you activated in the selected area.
Welcome to the New Game Plus Menu!
Start a new adventure using your \c[3]Trophy Points\c[0] to unlock special modifiers to alter the game and create your very own unique experience!
Select an option to activate it. Groups with \c[3]square checkboxes\c[0] let you select \c[3]multiple options\c[0].
Groups with \c[3]round checkboxes\c[0] only allow for \c[3]one option\c[0] to be selected.
If an options is selected that \c[3]requires a save file\c[0], you will be asked to \c[3]select one before starting the game\c[0].

pages.title: \c[1]Things that cannot be carried over\c[0]
content: --\c[3]Key Items\c[0]
--\c[3]Contacts\c[0]
--\c[3]Quest Progress\c[0]
--\c[3]Statistics\c[0]
Welcome to the Options Menu!
In this menu you can change various settings to customize your game experience. Use \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] to navigate through the tabs.
Some options might require a restart. Options like these are \c[3]marked with a red information text.\c[0]
Options are saved as soon as you leave the main menu.
Use \i[help2] to reset all settings back to default. This will also reset all your key bindings.
Welcome to the Records Menu!
This menu features a wide array of information about all your quests, stats and achievements!
On the left side you can a see a quick summary including your \c[3]current task\c[0] and your \c[3]latest activities.\c[0]
To see more activities go the \c[3]Activity Log\c[0] Tab in the Statistics Menu.

quests.title: \c[3]Quest Menu\c[0]

content: Welcome to the Quest Menu!
In this menu you can watch all your active and finished quests.
Cycle through the tabs using \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right].
Selecting a quest shows you a quick summary including the latest fulfilled tasks and description.
Pressing on a quest opens the \c[3]Detail View\c[0]. This menu gives you a more precise look at a quest.

pages.title: \c[3]Quest Menu\c[0] - Favorites
content: Pressing \i[help2] while hovering over a quest in the active section marks it as favorite quest. Pressing \i[help2] on a marked quest un-favorites it.
Favorite quests are highlighted outside the menu in the top-right corner of the screen.
You can change between them outside the menu by using \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right] on the keyboard or by pressing \i[left-stick] and \i[right-stick] on the gamepad.
You will only cycle through the ones you marked as favorite.

pages.title: \c[3]Quest Menu\c[0] - Sub Quest
content: A quest can have up to 4 sub quests.
In case such a quests is activated, all sub quests are indented below the parent quest when the \c[3]Date\c[0] or \c[3]Auto\c[0] Sorting is active. This way you always know where a sub quest belongs.

quests.text-2:
Hover over a quest in the Active Quest Section and press \i[help2] to set it as a favorite! 

Do the same on a faved quest to un-favorite it.

content: Welcome to the Shop Menu!
In this menu you can buy items or sell them if you don't need them.
Use \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right] to cycle through the categories or press on the tabs if you use the mouse.
Press on an item to select the quantity you want to buy. You can use the \i[up]\i[left]\i[down]\i[right] to change the amount.
Press \i[help2] to open the checkout view when you have at least one item in your cart. Once you sure you want to buy or sell the selected items, press Buy/Sell to confirm.

pages.title: \c[3]Shop Menu\c[0] - Additional Info
content: When an item is selected you can use \i[left] and \i[right] to de- or increase the number by one directly.
Some vendors might only have one category from which you can buy items. This is indicated by the grey buttons next to the category name.
Welcome to the Save Menu!
In this menu you can save your progress and see all the save files you have created.
Scroll through the save slots using \i[mousewheel] with the mouse or the direction buttons on the gamepad.
Click on a slot or press \i[gamepad-a] on the gamepad to save the game on the selected slot.
Press \i[help3] to create \c[3]a new save file\c[0] or \i[help2] to \c[3]delete a save file\c[0] by hovering over a slot.
You can also use the first entry in the list to create a new save file.

pages.title: \c[3]Save Menu\c[0] - Save Files
content: A single save file displays some basic information about you progress:
--\c[3]Chapter\c[0]:-- Reflects your story progress via the chapter you are in and a small graphic.
--\c[3]Level\c[0]:-- The level you have on this save file.
--\c[3]Location\c[0]:-- The area and map you saved in.
--\c[3]Element\c[0]:-- The elements you have on this save file.
--\c[3]Version\c[0]:-- Displayed at the bottom right. It shows the version of the game where this save was first created with.
--\c[3]Playtime\c[0]:-- The play time of this save file.
--\c[3]Credit\c[0]:-- The money you accumulated.
Welcome to the Load Menu!
In this menu you can load a save file and start where you left.
Scroll through the save slots using \i[mousewheel] with the mouse or the direction buttons on the gamepad.
Click on a slot or press \i[gamepad-a] on the gamepad to load the save file on the selected slot.
Press \i[help2] to \c[3] delete a save file\c[0] by hovering over a slot.

pages.title: \c[3]Load Menu\c[0] - Save Files
content: A single save file displays some basic information about you progress:
--\c[3]Chapter\c[0]:-- Reflects your story progress via the chapter you are in and a small graphic.
--\c[3]Level\c[0]:-- The level you have on this save file.
--\c[3]Element\c[0]:-- The elements you have on this save file.
--\c[3]Location\c[0]:-- The area and map you saved in.
--\c[3]Version\c[0]:-- Displayed at the bottom right. It shows the version of the game where this save was first created with.
--\c[3]Playtime\c[0]:-- The play time of this save file.
--\c[3]Credit\c[0]:-- The money you accumulated.
Welcome to the Encyclopedia!
In this menu you can read about all the interesting topics you come across while exploring CrossWorlds.
Cycle through the tabs using \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right].
Select an entry to to highlight and scroll through its content.
You can also use \i[left] or \i[right] while hovering an entry to scroll through it directly. On gamepad using \i[right-stick] does the same.

pages.title: \c[3]Encyclopedia\c[0] - Unlocking Lore Entries
content: There are multiple ways to unlock lore entries. You can either just talk to people or find more information about a topic by progressing the \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0].
\c[3][Sergey Note]\c[0]
I added some extra code here for you, Lea. Next to the in-game categories I added one for your progress and one for characters.
I will insert those entries for you when they come along!
Welcome to the Monster Fibula!
In this menu you can find detailed information about every enemy you encounter.
Cycle through the tabs using \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right].
Select an entry to reveal the first page of the enemy and use \i[page-left] or \i[page-right] to switch pages.
If you find the tag "special" above the enemy view than that means you unlocked an enemy through a \c[3]special event or a quest\c[0].

pages.title: \c[3]Monster Fibula\c[0] - Reports
content: Reports are unlocked by first defeating an enemy a certain amount of times.
They show useful information or trivia about the selected enemy.
This first page, including the species of the enemy, will always be unlocked.
Additional reports are unlocked through various tasks, such as defeating even more of enemy, solving quest, progressing the story and so on.
Welcome to the Trader Book!
This menu offers a log of every trader you met in each area.
Cycle through the tabs using \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right].
Select an entry to reveal a detailed overview over what items you need and how much it will cost you.
While the detail view is open you can still switch through tabs and select different items.
Welcome to the Status Menu!
This menu gives you a detailed look at all your stats and parameters for all available elements.
Use \i[page-left] and \i[page-right] to switch through your elements.
To switch between the different views, use \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right]. Available views are:
--\c[3]Summary\c[0]
--\c[3]Parameters\c[0]
--\c[3]Modifiers\c[0]
--\c[3]Combat Arts\c[0]

pages.title: \c[3]Status Menu\c[0] - Summary
content: As the name suggests the summary services as an overview over your equipment and stats.
The parameters shown on the left are your final parameters for the currently selected element, including equipment and skills.

pages.title: \c[3]Status Menu\c[0] - Parameters
content: This views displays your base parameters for the currently selected element.

For each parameter you can see how the final value comes together based of the \c[3]Base Value\c[0], the \c[3]Equipment\c[0] and finally the \c[3]Skill Additions\c[0] from the Circuits. The description shows the purpose of each parameter.
To see the absolute values of each step for the final value of a parameter press \i[help3].

pages.title: \c[3]Status Menu\c[0] - Modifiers
content: This views displays all modifiers from your equipment and the currently selected element.

For each modifier you can see how the final value comes together based of your \c[3]Equipment\c[0] and the \c[3]Skill Additions\c[0] from the Circuits. The description shows the function of each modifier.
To see the absolute values of each step for the final value of a modifier press \i[help3].

pages.title: \c[3]Status Menu\c[0] - Combat Arts
content: This views displays all currently active combat arts seperated by type. (\c[3]Throw\c[0], \c[3]Melee\c[0], \c[3]Dash\c[0], \c[3]Guard\c[0])
Next to the name and description, each Art shows how many \c[3]SP\c[0] are consumed, the damage modifier and additional effects.
The damage type (displayed as DMG) highlights if the damage is either \c[3]Melee\c[0], \c[3]Ranged\c[0], \c[3]Mixed\c[0] or \c[3]None\c[0].
Effects show both the \c[3]Stun Type\c[0] and if the Art inflict a status condition. Stun Types can be the following:
--\c[3]\i[status-stun-1]Interrupt\c[0]:-- These Arts can interrupt enemy attacks.
--\c[3]\i[status-stun-2]Lock\c[0]:-- These Arts lock enemies in place until its finished.
Welcome to the Party Menu!
In this menu you can invite/remove other players into your party or contact them.
Hover over a contact to get a closer look at the stats and equipment of the player.
Click on a slot or press \i[gamepad-a] on the gamepad to invite/remove the player.
This way you can also contact the player. Note that some players might not answer if they are not online.
Welcome to the Statistics Menu!

This menu is a compilation of all your progress in numbers. Use \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] to navigate through the categories. To scroll through a category use the mouse wheel or \i[down] and \i[up].
Welcome to the Botanics Menu!
This menus lists all destructible environmental objects found in CrossWorlds. Use \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] to navigate through the areas.
Each object first needs to be analyzed, which is done by simply destroying them and collecting the drops.
Once \c[3]50% are analyzed\c[0] you can see the location of the object and once \c[3]100% is reach, all items the object can drop are revealed\c[0].
Welcome to the Trade Menu!
Here you can trade your items against other items as long as you fulfil the requirements and have enough credits.
A trader can have multiple offers. Use \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] to navigate through them.
The values in \c[3]brackets show how many of the required items you have\c[0]. If the offer is a piece of equipment you can check the parameters on the left side.
Welcome to the Bulletin Board!
This menus lists all quests \c[3]available in the surrounding areas\c[0].
The 3 tabs show open, active and finished quests in that order. Use \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] to navigate through the tabs.
At the bottom you can see how many quests are currently available and your completion rate on this Bulletin Board.
Welcome to the Trophy Menu!
This menus showcases all your accomplishments. You can also see what you need to do for to unlock a trophy, at least for most of them.
Trophies are separated by 3 categories: \c[3]General\c[0], \c[3]Combat\c[0] and \c[3]Exploration\c[0]. Use \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] to navigate through the tabs.
Each tab can have multiple sections. Click on one or use \i[left] or \i[right] to show the trophies within them.

descriptions.MAXHP:
Increases MaxHP by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0]. 
Determines how much HP you can have to survive damage.
descriptions.ATK:
Increases Attack by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0]. 
Increases the damage you can deal with your attacks.
descriptions.DEF:
Increases Defense by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0]. 
Decreases the damage you take and improves guarding.
descriptions.FOC:
Increases Focus by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0]. 
Determines frequency of critical hits and status effects, the time window for parry and dash invincibility and your SP Gain.
descriptions.ALL_ELEMENT_RES: Increases resistance to all Elements by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0].
descriptions.RANGED_DAMAGE: Increases the damage of Ranged Attacks by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0].
descriptions.CHARGED_KNOCKBACK: Increases the knockback distance of charged projectiles by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0].
descriptions.MELEE_DAMAGE: Increases the damage of Melee Attacks by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0].
descriptions.ASSAULT: Melee attacks fire additional small projectiles for \c[3][xyz]%\c[0] of the base damage.
descriptions.CRITICAL_DAMAGE: Increases the damage of Critical Strikes by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0].
descriptions.AIMING_SPEED: Decreases time needed to aim by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0].
descriptions.AIMING_STABILITY: Decreases the loss of aim from quick aim movement and dashes by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0].
descriptions.AIMING_MOVEMENT_SPEED: Increases your movement speed while aiming by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0].
descriptions.DASH_DISTANCE: Prolongs the invincibility when dashing by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0].
descriptions.GUARD_STRENGTH: Strengthens your shield and decreases the damage taken when guarding by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0].
descriptions.ADDITIONAL_GUARD_AREA: Allows to guard against attacks \c[3]from the side\c[0]. Activate twice to guard attacks \c[3]from above\c[0] too.
descriptions.ADDITIONAL_GUARD_AREA_2: Allows to guard against attacks \c[3]from above\c[0].
descriptions.STUN_THRESHOLD: Increases the immunity to knockback from attacks by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0], depending on MaxHP.
descriptions.STATUS_CONDITION_EFFECT_HEAT:
Increases the speed of inflicting the \c[3]Burn\c[0] Condition and its effect by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0]. 
\c[3]Burn\c[0] causes damage over time, depending on the MaxHP of the victim.
descriptions.STATUS_CONDITION_EFFECT_COLD:
Increases the speed of inflicting the \c[3]Chill\c[0] Condition and its effect by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0]. 
\c[3]Chill\c[0] decreases the overall speed of the victim.
descriptions.STATUS_CONDITION_EFFECT_SHOCK:
Increases the speed of inflicting the \c[3]Jolt\c[0] Condition and its effect by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0]. 
\c[3]Jolt\c[0] causes damage and stuns in short intervals.
descriptions.STATUS_CONDITION_EFFECT_WAVE:
Increases the speed of inflicting the \c[3]Mark\c[0] Condition and its effect by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0]. 
\c[3]Mark\c[0] increases the received ranged damage by 50%.
descriptions.STATUS_CONDITION_GUARD_HEAT:
Increases the resistance against the \c[3]Burn\c[0] Condition and reduces its effect by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0]. 
\c[3]Burn\c[0] causes damage over time, depending on the MaxHP of the victim.
descriptions.STATUS_CONDITION_GUARD_COLD:
Increases the resistance against the \c[3]Chill\c[0] Condition and reduces its effect by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0]. 
\c[3]Chill\c[0] decreases the overall speed of the victim.
descriptions.STATUS_CONDITION_GUARD_SHOCK:
Increases the resistance against the \c[3]Jolt\c[0] Condition and reduces its effect by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0]. 
\c[3]Jolt\c[0] causes damage and stuns in short intervals.
descriptions.STATUS_CONDITION_GUARD_WAVE:
Increases the resistance against the \c[3]Mark\c[0] Condition and reduces its effect by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0]. 
\c[3]Mark\c[0] increases the received ranged damage by 50%.
descriptions.STATUS_CONDITION_HEALING: Increases the recovery speed from all negative status conditions by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0].
descriptions.HP_REGENERATION: Regenerates \c[3][xyz]%\c[0] of HP over 60 seconds of combat. Healing frequency increases with higher percentage.
descriptions.OVERHEAT_REDUCTION: Slows down the Elemental Overload by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0].
descriptions.ITEM_BOOST: Increases the effect of healing and the duration of buffs from items by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0].
descriptions.SPIKE_DAMAGE: When guarding, reflects \c[3][xyz]%\c[0] of the total absorbed damage back on the attacker.
descriptions.CROSS_COUNTER: Increases damage on enemies that are attacking or charging by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0].
descriptions.BERSERKER: Increases Damage by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0] when at critical HP. (Below 33% of MaxHP)
descriptions.BREAK_DMG: Increases Damage on enemies that are stunned, weak or in break state by \c[3][xyz]%\c[0].
descriptions.ONCE_MORE: Survive exactly \c[3]one attack\c[0] that would normally kill you.
descriptions.GUARD_SP: Restores SP on guard based on \c[3][xyz]%\c[0] of the attack's power. (\c[3]Double\c[0] for perfect guard)
descriptions.ACTIVE_PLACEHOLDER: \c[3]Placeholder\c[0] for a Special Attack that can be learned in future versions.

arena-confirm.name: Confirm Arena Dialogs
arena-confirm.description: Tick if menu actions in the arena should be confirmed.

arena-cam-focus.name: Camera Center Focus
arena-cam-focus.description: If ticked, focuses camera to the center of the stage for most rounds.

item-hud-size.name: Item HUD Size
item-hud-size.description: Changes the size of the item notification window.

update-quest-style.name: Task Updates
update-quest-style.description: Changes how completed tasks in quests are displayed.

update-landmark-style.name: Landmark Updates
update-landmark-style.description: Changes how new landmarks are displayed when found.

update-lore-style.name: Encyclopedia Updates
update-lore-style.description: Changes how new Encyclopedia entries are displayed when found.

update-drop-style.name: Botanics Updates
update-drop-style.description: Changes how new Botanics completion is displayed when achieved.

update-trophy-style.name: Trophy Updates
update-trophy-style.description: Changes how new trophies are displayed when achieved.

hp-bars.name: Party Status Bars
hp-bars.description: Change under which party members status bars are shown.

party-combat-arts.name: Party Combat Arts
party-combat-arts.description: Change how Combat Arts execution is shown for party members.

quick-menu-access.name: Quick Menu Access
quick-menu-access.description: The access style to toggle the quick menu.

skip-confirm.name: Confirm Cutscene Skip
skip-confirm.description: Tick if skipping cutscenes should be confirmed.

game-sense.name: Enable Game Sense
game-sense.description: Tick if Game Sense (Steel Series Engine 3) should be enabled.

equip-level-display.name: Show Levels in Equipment
equip-level-display.description: Enables the display in the equip menu which shows the player- and average equip level.

enemy-status-bars.name: Enemy Status Bar
enemy-status-bars.description: Tick if enemy status bars should be shown below enemies.

level-letter-display.name: Show Level Symbol
level-letter-display.description: Shows the Level Symbol next to the level of an equipment item.

buff-help.name: Show Buff Help
buff-help.description: Shows a small help text when hovering consumables in the inventory.

skip-tutorials.name: Skip Tutorials
skip-tutorials.description: Tick if all optional tutorials should be skipped. \c[1]Not recommended for first playthrough!\c[0]

quest-show-current.name: Show Finished Tasks
quest-show-current.description: Tick to show the task that was finished when a quest updates instead of the next task.

min-sidebar.name: Small Right Sidebars
min-sidebar.description: Tick to make right sidebar smaller. Only works with a \c[3]Pixel Size\c[0] of 2 or higher.

xeno-pointer.name: Show Dialog Pointer
xeno-pointer.description: Tick to show an effect if an NPC can be talked while text is above it.

difficulty.name: Difficulty
difficulty.description: The difficulty of the game. TODO add better text

rumble-strength.name: Screen shake
rumble-strength.description: Changes the strength of screen shake effects.

message-padding.name: Message Padding
message-padding.description: Changes the padding around texts in dialog bubbles/boxes.

text-speed.name: Text Speed
text-speed.description: The speed at which text appears in dialogs and side messages.

pause-unfocused.name: Pause when unfocused
pause-unfocused.description: Pause the game when window is out of focus.

circuit-text-size.name: Circuit Info Box Size
circuit-text-size.description: The size of the info box when hovering over a skill node in the circuit menu.

circuit-display-time.name: Circuit Info Display Time
circuit-display-time.description: The time the info box stays after leaving focus on a node in the circuit menu.

min-quest.name: Minimize Quest Window
min-quest.description: Displays only the name and progress of the quest in the favorite quest window.

circuit-quick-change.name: Circuit Chain Activation
circuit-quick-change.description: Allows to chain activate nodes in the circuit menu when selecting a node.

hud-display.name: Display HUD
hud-display.description: Toggles the status display in the top left corner.

close-circle.name: Show Melee Indicator
close-circle.description: Toggles the circle indicating the close combat range for mouse input.

element-select.name: Show Element on Lea
element-select.description: Toggles the current element display when switching elements on Lea.

element-overload.name: Show Element Overload
element-overload.description: Toggles the corner graphics indicating element overload.

language.name: Language
language.description: The language of the game. \c[1]Needs a restart!

low-health-warning.name: Show Low Health Warning
low-health-warning.description: Toggles the corner graphics for low health.

combat-art-name.name: Show Combat Art Name
combat-art-name.description: Toggles if the name of a combat art should be displayed above Lea when executed.

sp-bar.name: Show SP Bar
sp-bar.description: Toggles if the SP bar should be shown when using Arts or recovering SP.

damage-numbers.name: Show Damage Numbers
damage-numbers.description: Toggles the damage numbers. This applies to healing numbers too.

damage-numbers-crit.name: Show Only Criticals
damage-numbers-crit.description: If selected only shows critical hit numbers. (Healing numbers are still displayed)

s-rank-effects.name: S-Rank Music & Effects
s-rank-effects.description: If selected: play S-Rank music and show special effects.

show-items.name: Show Item Notification
show-items.description: Toggles the item notification window when obtaining an item.

show-money.name: Show Money Notification
show-money.description: Toggles the money notification window when obtaining money.

quick-cursor.name: Save Cursor Position
quick-cursor.description: If ticked, saves the cursor position in the quick item menu.

quick-element.name: Allow Element Switch
quick-element.description: Tick to be able to switch elements while in the quick-menu.

quick-location.name: Location Display
quick-location.description: \c[3]Quick\c[0]: Show when in Quick menu. \c[3]Map\c[0]: Show when entering map. \c[3]Disable\c[0]: Never show.

display-type.name: Display Type
display-type.description: Changes the Scaling used for the box the game runs in.

gamepad-attack.name: Attack / Charge
gamepad-attack.description: Button for attack and throwing. The other button will be used for special attacks.

gamepad-dash.name: Dash / Quick Menu
gamepad-dash.description: Button for dashing and guarding. The other button will be used for the quick menu.

double-pixels.name: Double Pixel Size
double-pixels.description: Increases the pixel size resulting in less blurry graphics.  \c[1]Needs a restart!

pixel-size.name: Pixel Size
pixel-size.description: Higher size means sharper image. May reduce FPS. \c[1]Needs a restart!

speedlines.name: Speed Lines
speedlines.description: Toggles speed lines shown during important combat events.

weather.name: Weather Effects
weather.description: Toggles the weather effects like rain and snow.

effects.name: Effect Details
effects.description: Sets the details on overall effects.

volume-master.name: Master Volume
volume-master.description: Sets the overall volume of the game.

volume-music.name: Music Volume
volume-music.description: Sets the volume of the music in the game.

volume-sound.name: Sound Volume
volume-sound.description: Sets the volume of the sounds in the game.

web-audio.name: Use Web Audio
web-audio.description: Enables WebAudio for better sound quality and positioned sounds. \c[1]Needs a restart!

close-combat-input.name: Melee Mouse Input
close-combat-input.description: Enables being able to click close to Lea to execute a melee attack.

element-wheel.name: Element Mouse Wheel
element-wheel.description: If ticked you can use the mouse wheel to change the element mode.

controls.description: Set the normal or alternative key used for the selected option.
controls.reset: Some options take effect after a restart of the game.

assist-damage.name: Received Damage
assist-damage.description: Scales the amount of damage you receive from enemies.

assist-attack-frequency.name: Enemy Attack Frequency
assist-attack-frequency.description: Scales the frequency by which enemies attack.

assist-puzzle-speed.name: Puzzle Speed
assist-puzzle-speed.description: Scales down the speed or increases durations of puzzle elements such as switch timers.

assists-description.description: \c[3]CrossCode\c[0] was designed with \c[3]challenge\c[0] in mind. However, if this makes the game less enjoyable or even inaccessible for you, you can use these options \c[3]to tweak the difficulty\c[0] to your liking!

shakeit.pre: Can thee not seeth yond i am singing?

loading.trophyUpdate: Trophies have changed and we tried to make sure you got all the trophies you should have until this point.
loading.skillUpdate: The Skill tree structure has changed, so we had to reset your skill configuration. Sorry! You can reassign your skills again.
loading.versionOutdated: This save file is outdated, bugs might occur. Use at own risk!
loading.questUpdate: Some quests have changed. Those have been resetted. This means you might have to re-do some tasks or you get your rewards after you close this message.
